verses.verse: (Bildad proveth that no man is clean nor without sin before God.) Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,

(His purpose is to prove that albeit God try and afflict the just, yet soon after he sendeth prosperity, and because he did not so to Job he concludeth that he is wicked.) Power and fear is with him, that maketh peace in his places.
Is there any number in his armies? (Who can hide him from his presence?) and upon whom shall not his light arise?
And how may a man (That is, be just in respect of God?) be justified with God? or how can he be clean that is born of woman?

Behold, he will give no light to the Moon, (If God show his power, the Moon and Stars cannot have that light which is given them, much less can man have any excellency, but of God.) and the Stars are unclean in his sight.
How much more man, a worm, even the son of man, which is but a worm?
